articles.author: Mariella Moon
articles.title: Apple's AirTag 4-pack has never been cheaper
articles.description: If you have several items (or pets) you want to keep track of, this is a great chance to grab multiple Apple AirTags at once. You can pick up a four-pack from Best Buy for $84.55, or $14.45 less than its retail price of $99. That's even cheaper than the packa…

articles.title: Google Nest cameras now work with Amazon Alexa devices
articles.description: The smart home ecosystem is getting a little more integrated: Google just updated its Amazon Alexa Skill to work on its latest Nest cameras. So if you already own a variety of Nest and Alexa devices, they'll work together more seamlessly moving forward. Now, …

articles.author: Corin Faife
articles.title: Apple, Google, and Microsoft will soon implement passwordless sign-in on all major platforms
articles.description: On World Password Day, Apple, Google, and Microsoft committed to broad support over the next year for secure FIDO “passkey” sign-in technology that removes the need for passwords at all.
articles.content:
Illustration by Alex Castro / The Verge

 

 On May 5th — World Password Day — we might have come one step closer to passwords being a thing of the past.
In a joint effort, tech giants Apple, Google… [+4527 chars]

articles.author: Victoria Song
articles.title: How to track your menstrual cycles on a smartwatch
articles.description: There’s no shortage of period tracking apps for your phone, but a few smartwatches and fitness trackers — the Apple Watch, Fitbits, Garmins, and Samsung Galaxy Watches — will also allow you to view your cycle and input data straight from your wrist.
articles.content:
Apple introduced Cycle Tracking on the Series 5. | Photography by Victoria Song / The Verge
